this is the site nav as it currently stands (🗺️ GolfGod Mini Site Navigation Tree & Functionality

  Navigation Structure

  🏠 Welcome Screen (/)
      ├── Tour Selection Hub
      │   ├── PGA Tour (active) ──→ Navigation Hub
      │   ├── European Tour (coming Q2 2025)
      │   ├── Asian Tour (coming Q3 2025)
      │   └── Korn Ferry Tour (coming Q4 2025)
      │
      └── 📍 Navigation Hub (/hub)
          ├── 👤 Choose Player (/player)
          │   ├── Player List Selection
          │   ├── Player Profile Display
          │   ├── 2024 Season Stats
          │   ├── Tournament History
          │   └── Individual Player Detail (/player/:playerId) → ESPN-style results
          │
          ├── 🏆 Choose Tournament (/tournament)
          │   ├── This Week's Tournament (current)
          │   ├── Completed Tournaments (36)
          │   └── Upcoming Tournaments (12)
          │
          └── 📊 Inside the Ropes (/inside-ropes)
              └── 🚧 Under Development

  Component Functionality Breakdown

  1. Welcome Screen (/)

  - Purpose: Entry point with tour selection
  - Features:
    - Animated golf-themed background (brown → orange → terracotta gradient)
    - Floating animation effects
    - Tour selection cards with availability status
    - Only PGA Tour currently active
  - Navigation: Clicking PGA Tour → /hub

  2. Navigation Hub (/hub)

  - Purpose: Central hub for feature selection
  - Features:
    - Three main navigation cards:
        - Player Analytics (156 players available)
      - Tournament Central (36 events)
      - Inside the Ropes (coming soon)
    - Quick stats dashboard
    - Back navigation to Welcome Screen
  - Navigation: Cards route to respective dashboards

  3. Player Dashboard (/player)

  - Purpose: Player selection and analytics viewing
  - Features:
    - Player list in collapsible sections
    - Selected player profile display
    - 2024 season statistics
    - Tournament history
    - Comprehensive metrics (SG:APP, Fairways Hit %, Putts/Round)
  - Data Sources: Hybrid database/mock data system
  - Navigation:
    - Back to Hub
    - Click player → /player/:playerId for detailed view

  4. ESPN Player Results (/player/:playerId)

  - Purpose: Individual player deep-dive statistics
  - Features:
    - ESPN-style player header with photo/stats
    - Tournament results by tour
    - Year selector for historical data
    - Performance metrics and trends
  - Data: Player-specific tournament results

  5. Tournament Dashboard (/tournament)

  - Purpose: Tournament browsing and information
  - Features:
    - Three tabs:
        - Current week's tournament
      - Completed tournaments (36)
      - Upcoming tournaments (12)
    - Tournament cards with details:
        - Dates, purse, field size
      - Course information
      - Status indicators
  - Navigation: Back to Hub

  6. Inside the Ropes (/inside-ropes)

  - Status: 🚧 Under Development
  - Planned: Expert analysis, course insights, betting strategies

  Key UI/UX Features

  Design System:
  - Golf-themed color palette (cream, sand, orange, terracotta, brown)
  - Glass morphism effects with backdrop blur
  - Responsive mobile-first design
  - Smooth animations and transitions

  Navigation Patterns:
  - Hierarchical flow: Welcome → Hub → Feature
  - Consistent back navigation
  - Clear status indicators (available/coming soon)
  - Badge-based categorization

  Data Flow:
  - React Query for state management
  - Fallback to mock data when database unavailable
  - Type-safe with Zod validation
  - 5-minute cache for performance

  This navigation structure provides a clear, progressive disclosure pattern where users start with
  high-level tour selection, move to feature selection, then dive into specific analytics views.) can you tell me the place to edit and how to make it formatted similar to this [Image #2]
